content.webTitle: Market forces: FTSE 100 hits Christmas high

fields.headline: FTSE 100 hits Christmas high
fields.bodyText: Ho, ho, ho - the FTSE 100 hit a new high for Christmas today, breaking through the 5400 barrier to end the half-day trading session 30.03 points higher at 5402.41, its highest close for 15 months. This topped the previous 2009 intraday high of 5396.96, which was reached on 16 November, and the closing high of 5382.67 on the same day. Trading volumes were tiny but, after a slow start, there was a late surge in the final hour of trading. The London market has now powered ahead by 56% since reaching its nadir of 3461 points in the dark days of March. For the year so far, the FTSE 100 is ahead by 22%.
